name: hyper
description: A terminal built on web technologies

scripts.pack: npm run build && build --dir && babel --no-comments --compact --minified --out-file app/dist/bundle.js app/dist/bundle.js

releases.body:
Fix issues with CSS class names ðŸ™ˆ

### Patches 

- Fix babili options so that they don't mangle our classnames 5c0edf5f9f05b27bc7fc17b39e34f3139e854e97 

Thanks @henrikdahl for reporting and helping debug

Bye tab focus issue! + Lots of Win/Linux fixes ### Improvements #### Fix dragging and dropping URLs into the terminal. ![2017-02-15 18 10 44](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/13041/22995658/7cde61a8-f3aa-11e6-923c-ffc76a0d0961.gif) - Inserts them as text into the shell instead of navigating! - Thanks @grahamkennery df0a3c60ed755006a1bacbf571b2f1274ca6deaf #### Add right click to copy - Configurable via `quickEdit` in `~/.hyper.js`. - Default `true` for Windows, `false` otherwise - Thanks @Specro 270fe5bef97b2abb5599f61073a6e28c34c408c4 #### Others - Make the scrollbar look the same on all platforms (@stefanivic) ed282560fbe1c3b8d6859ba6083a030330ed6333 - Make titlebar look better on Windows (@paulcbetts) 0ff1cb9584df097159f23431fdf5feafb80a9cb9 ### Bugfixes - Fixed plugin installation in the Fish shell (@knewter) 6fac65e2d2b2cbfe0b8a3f9f22abcfba9cff057f - Fixed "shell configuration change" warning when the shell hasn't changed (@matheuss) d44deb32c84e984eb9be8e3f1a441787a35cee01 - Fixed copy+paste for Linux and Windows (@matheuss) b4943a05e9a614d00f4bf7203e4146efa47d1adb - Fixed up/down on Bash for Windows via `node-pty` (@Tyriar) ### Meta-improvements _Improvements on the docs, plugin hooks, DX, â€¦_ - Fix task (`npm run pack`) for producing a prod-like bundle during dev (@rauchg) 2094765bf08a9239a4c95d61e73aad810994dc26 - Add instructions to install via Chocolatey (@chantisnake) 62c0f80493a0d14c5ceec4f639b6fc4f2ea791f7 - The Hyper website is now under this main repo (under `./website`) to simplify docs contributions (@matheuss) - Bump webpack to `2.2.0` (@matheuss) 40d5c2fbe0d7b07d3b2e73dfb15549186d4d2dbb - Update Windows installations instructions (@felixrieseberg) 6f758654d2adfe9209c5f525439e632dff7f3024 - Add `reduceTermGroups` docs reference for plugin authors (@chabou) a2acccabe72a172a5d82d529b483d06a2dd50c4d - Improve notes for `node-pty` compilation (@matheuss) 28e7e8e75cf577e527f5cc6ae205a7348174ac7f ### Credits - Special thanks to @paulcbetts who is helping us with Windows support - Special thanks to @chabou, @ppot, @albinekb and the entire Hyper community for their sustained help!

20% faster bootup + bug fixes + better plugin DX We improved bootup time by making the JS bundle 20% faster (parse and evaluation time). We also fixed a race condition seen if you had special characters in the first data packet coming from the terminal (e.g.: the prompt), which could sometimes be rendered as follows: Many other fixes from multiple contributors! Read onâ€¦ ### Minor Changes - Expose decorate to plugins: #1261 - Use local config file in dev (fix #903): #904 ### Patches - Ensure line endings are correct on Windows: #1230 - Prevent loosing focus after a char composition ended by Tab key (fix #1341): #1349 - Scrollbar Fix on macOS (fix #100) #1354 - Fix decoding race condition with new terminal sessions: #1366 - 20% faster bootup time: #1350 ### Credits Huge thanks to @timneutkens, @chabou, @paulcbetts, @micopc and @rauchg for their help!

Perf improvements and URL, emojis, + bug fixes ðŸ˜±
- Fix lingering text selection upon paste (#819, PR #1218) [@ppot]
- Fix matching of URLs (#1253, #1210, #1042 , #910, #594, #97, PR #1216, PR #1259) [@kevinramsunder, @ppot]
- Fix issues with zsh and improve unicode performance (#1131, #1116, #96,  PR #1111) [@dotcypress]
- Add `Consolas` to the list of default fonts for Windows (PR #1196) [@mqudsi]
- Reset background color after reloading (PR #1262) [@ppot]
- `line-height` improvements for rendering emoji (PR #1322) [@dotcypress]

Also note-worthy: URL support will probably move into a _core plugin_ in the near future_.

We'll be introducing, highlighting and documenting a series of core-maintained plugins that you'll be able to include as `@hyper/plugin` inside your config ðŸŽ‰

Hyper 1.0.0 is here! ## Windows support and improved Linux support We are very excited to announce that we now support **Windows** â€“ and we're also shipping a first-class **Linux** version: - We moved from [`child_pty`](https://github.com/Gottox/child_pty) to [`pty.js`](https://github.com/Tyriar/pty.js) â€“ they're both great libraries to interact with a pseudo terminal, but just the latter supports Windows â€“ https://github.com/zeit/hyper/pull/946/commits/33844425a9fb094cbcd64a596d813ace96c68d40 â€“ [Thanks @tyriar] - We rewrote the UI for the tabs in order for them to work with Electron's constraints on Windows and Linux â€“ https://github.com/zeit/hyper/pull/946/commits/f8a8da645fecc2f7c7e33587bc4b14f267cf9842 â€“ [@CodeTheory] - We added a _hamburguer menu_ so the application menu can be easily accessed â€“ [@CodeTheory + @evilrabbit] Check #946 and #1058 for more info ## Improved internationalization and foreign keyboards support We are shipping a fix for a very common issue: if you're using a _foreign_ keyboard, such as Portuguese, Norwegian, Swedish etc, you weren't able to type some characters like `Ã¡`, `Ã¤`, `~` and so on. That's not the case anymore! - We inject a `hyper-caret` div with `contenteditable="true"` inside the `hterm`'s cursor. With that, we're able to listen for the [composition events](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/Events/compositionstart) â€“ with them, we can _morph_ the cursor to show some visual feedback when you are typing a composed character â€“ https://github.com/zeit/hyper/pull/1006 ## Unicode and emojis This version comes with an initial fix for issues with _special_ Unicode characters â€“ and Emojis ðŸ˜. Thanks to our amazing contributors, you will now see the following instead of a bunch of ï¿½s: - We patched `hterm` to make it handle strings with _special_ Unicode characters correctly â€“ some emojis are composed of multiple characters, so we need to be careful when splitting a string to render it https://github.com/zeit/hyper/pull/1018 â€“ [@dotcypress] - We also patched the way `hterm` render special Unicode chars â€“ we now wrap each one with a `` instead of wrapping the entire line â€“ https://github.com/zeit/hyper/pull/740 â€“ [@BenoitAverty] ## Customize the look of the active session Now you can customize the look of the active session via the `.term_active` CSS class: - The active `` will receive an `active` CSS class. Therefore, after the rendering, the `.term_active` CSS class will be available. You can use it (and the absence of it) to customize any CSS property for the active split pane â€“ https://github.com/zeit/hyper/pull/905 â€“ [@weslleyaraujo] - Check [`hyper-simple-highlight-active-session`](https://github.com/matheuss/hyper-simple-highlight-active-session) for an example of how to use it. ## Vibrancy We are shipping a new Electron version that supports [vibrancy](https://github.com/electron/electron/blob/master/docs/api/browser-window.md#winsetvibrancytype-macos) on macOS: ![hyper-blur](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4721750/21105323/f21f1240-c070-11e6-9c7a-e451288eac7c.png) - You can choose from a [list of available vibrancy types](https://github.com/electron/electron/blob/master/docs/api/browser-window.md#winsetvibrancytype-macos). Make sure to check [`hyper-simple-vibrancy`](https://github.com/matheuss/hyper-simple-vibrancy) for an example of how to do it â€“ you will need to set a background color with some level of transparency to get a proper vibrancy effect ## Further improved developer experience We have improved the development workflow â€“ we hope that we made easier for you to contribute: - Instead of using a unified `start` task with `concurrently`, we now have separate `dev` and `start` tasks. This means that Hyper will not fail to boot anymore because Webpack is still working â€“ https://github.com/zeit/hyper/commit/ed76f4e4af7cc77a959f11ed9f1f1e401797fe32 - We introduced a `lint` task, so you can run only the linter to check if your code style match ours â€“ https://github.com/zeit/hyper/commit/332d3037efdb590b4e1178501ce91b012d2de355 ## Special thanks We'd like to thank these **22** contributors for their amazing work on Hyper â€“ they made this release possible! â¤ï¸ @BenoitAverty @breber @chabou @CodeTheory @davegomez @dfrankland @dotcypress @evilrabbit @flyngate @iamstarkov @mike-engel @oliverdunk @parro-it @ppot @Specro @stefanivic @timneutkens @tyriar @vors @weslleyaraujo @zbuttram â¤ï¸

Hyper early, hyper often!

Quick release to fix ugly error dialog when performing some filesystem operations. Shoutout to @shama creator of `gaze`, our file-watching dep, for his help debugging.

Many fixes, including paste ãƒ˜(â—•ã€‚â—•ãƒ˜) 

# Bug fixes
- Temporary workaround for paste bug [@flybayer]
- Bump `gaze` to prevent uncaught JavaScript exceptions during runtime [@rauchg]

# Performance improvements
- Only attempt to fetch remote notifications in the main process, instead of each window [@ekmartin]

# UI improvements
- Set default cursor opacity to 0.8 [@chabou]
- Set default background to white for webviews [@colepeters]

# DX improvements
- Expose `Component` to plugin authors [@timneutkens]
- Build Linux packages for 32 and 64 bit architectures [@fearphage]
- Run tests in Travis [@fearphage]
- Fix linting issues [@maxdeviant, @ekmartin]
- Fix lots of typos and finish renaming [@kenma9123, @shime, @danielbayerlein, @CodeTheory]

We received commits from 12 authors for this release. It's only been 9 days since 0.8.1! Thank you!

## New name Per our [announcement](https://zeit.co/blog/the-hyper-plan), we've renamed: - `.hyperterm.js` => `.hyper.js` - `.hyperterm_modules` => `.hyper_modules` When you first launch the app, we migrate you config automatically. Plugins will re-install automatically under the new location, and you can delete `.hyperterm_modules` manually later. You might see some plugin error notifications while that happens. ## Splits This version adds horizontal and vertical splits (âŒ˜+D and âŒ˜+Shift+D) For plugin developers, we've added new actions and reducers to be able to control these. See [term-groups](https://github.com/zeit/hyper/blob/master/lib/actions/term-groups.js). ## Transparency support I've refactored the tab bar (which might break some themes in the short run) so that it's 100% compatible with transparency support Some bugs exist in regards to the implementation of transparency in both Electron and Chrome, but this new release prepares us for the future. Almost every color configurable in `.hyper.js` ## Window position and size memorization Unless you configure a specific size and position in your config, we know remember the last used one across re-launches and new windows ## Window cascading New windows open automatically at an offset to avoid overlapping ![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/13041/19160098/74be7496-8ba3-11e6-9b2d-3ea0992f54eb.png) ## DX improvements We've improved a lot of the workflows related to running tests, linting, starting development (it now just takes a `npm start` to run webpack and launch electron). We've started using `xo` by @sindresorhus for consistent styling across the entire codebase
